intro: Remusatia vivipara, commonly known as the viviparous arrowhead, is a tropical aquatic plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its arrowhead-shaped leaves and its unique method of reproduction, where new plants develop from buds on the stems while still attached to the parent plant. The plant thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in marshes and swamps. Its rhizomes form dense underwater mats, helping to stabilize soil and prevent erosion. Remusatia vivipara is valued both for its ecological role and its ornamental appeal in aquatic gardens.
